node.text:
Making a difference and “brightening someone’s day” has always been on the top of my bucket list and what inspires my work every day.

In celebration of essie’s 40th birthday, I want to help you check this off your bucket list with #essie #eternaloptimist. 

I have created some art, using some of my favorite essie shades, for you to share with your friends and family to help brighten their day. Head over to @essie to see it! #essiepartner

node.text:
If you’ve ever been to a waterfall or heard the sound of one, it is likely that in one way or another, the waterfall caused you to stop in your tracks. Waterfalls are known around the world for their serene, peaceful beauty.

Every time I’ve personally been to a waterfall, just standing there and taking it all in is more than enough.

But every time I’ve had moments like this, this has come from the sidelines of the waterfall. Either looking down or looking up to the water falling, I’m not necessarily in danger, as a bystander, taking it all in.

Since I spend most of my life outside of the water, it’s easy to forget all that had to take place for this waterfall to be…the river flowing over hard rock and then soft rock that erodes in order for the waterfall to even exist. And it’s this gradual process of erosion that creates the waterfalls we see today.*

I do not know what the rocks and the water feel as they go through this process, but I do know this: in fact, a process…one that can be difficult to fully grasp when standing along the edges.

I think this can also true in other areas of life. When we arrive at some peaceful place, some peaceful moment…we can forget all it took to get there. We can forget all that the rivers carved and the rocks eroded into shape so we could enjoy this beautiful, peaceful wonder.

May we never forget
all it takes
for any beautiful
peaceful moment
to fall into place.
May we never forget
that even if it’s nothing more
than a deep breath,
a short rest,
or a brief quiet moment of a long day,
it took a lot to get here.
May we remain ever grateful
for all it took to be here.

MHN

*Source: Waterfall (Wikipedia)

node.text: This is an excerpt of today's podcast: "When You're Worried About The Future: 7 Phrases To Repeat To Yourself." While the future is unknown, it is my hope that these phrases can help you breathe in the present moment as you wait for what's to come. - Listen to "The Morgan Harper Nichols Show" on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and more -- link in the bio: @morganharpernichols

node.title: When You’re Worried About The Future

node.text:
I am sitting here today reading @christineyisuh ‘s posts (who I recommend following), because yesterday’s events in Atlanta are a painful reminder of the lack of change and justice — what happened yesterday breaks my heart and makes me angry. 

This uphill battle involves too big of a hill — the grief, weariness, and exhaustion from being gaslighted and not even being believed that your experiences are even real—it takes a toll on the body. The heart. The soul. It takes a toll on the community. 

We must listen to the stories and accounts of anti-Asian violence and racism. We must fight for justice. And to those on the receiving end of this racism, I just want you to know you are free to feel and you are worthy of spaces where your anger, grief, frustration, and outcries are not gaslighted and rejected...you are allowed to be angry or weary or exhausted of having to communicate, explain, and wait for change. No matter the ones who try to downplay the need for justice, you are worthy of support.

node.title: when you are weary waiting for change

node.text:
Transcript:
“you do not have to know
the names
of every tree
to see their individual,
yet collective beauty.
you can see how
they fit into the landscape
whether they offer shade
or whether they
bear flowers or fruit,
there is room
for trees
of all kinds
to grow
around you.
I wonder
what a difference it could make
if we saw beauty
in each other in the same way.
If we recognized that
no matter our age,
or our shape,
there was room
for each of us
to spring up from our roots
how we were meant to.
for there is an endless depth
to me and you,
that goes beyond what we see.
beyond the shade or size of our leaves,
beyond the color and texture of our bark,
this landscape
supports growth
right here
where you are.
some deciduous,
and others evergreen,
through every season
in the Light
every single tree
is seen.”
MHN

node.text:
take heart,
breathe deep, 
especially when
you have to say goodbye
before you were ready.
this will not be easy
and this you already know.
you are slowly moving through this.
you feel it in your bones.
and even here,
you free
to breathe and simply breathe.
feel what you need to feel.
and let every moment be
what it needs to be.

III

I think this
is the kind
of goodbye
that you don’t say out loud.
I might not find the words
until a few years from now.

I carry memories
like watercolor
running wild in my mind.
Some things  were meant to flow,
blues and yellows
you learn to let them go.

MHN

About this piece:
This is a piece written for anyone who has had to say goodbye before they were ready. Whether it was something beautiful that you never imagined going away, or something that would end in only a matter of time…I just hope you know it is okay to pace yourself through the spectrum of emotions that come along with that. This piece doesn’t end with a call-to-action resolve for a reason…I just wanted to create space for those feelings.

node.title: If you have to say goodbye before you're ready:

node.text:
Here's to practicing what I preach! I recorded this as an Instagram Story, but considering my last post, I figured -- why not post it here? For anyone who needs it!

3 ideas for going deeper with your writing:

IDEA #1
For the one who shares on their Instagram Story, but not as much on their feed: 

Go through your Instagram Story archives. Find the things you've said (whether written or spoken) that you haven't shared beyond that 24-hour time span. Even if it's just commentary on something that someone else shared, transcribe what you've written/shared on your Story from the past 60 days. Look at your transcriptions and then choose something to elaborate on in your Instagram Feed, blog post, or any place that challenges you to write at least 3 paragraphs. You can choose something randomly, or, you can pick what stands out to you the most. 

IDEA #2
For the one who takes little notes here and there, but doesn't know what to do with them:

Take 30 days worth of Notes App/Google Docs/Evernotes notes and put them into www.WordCounter.net. Look at the keywords that come up on the sidebar. Do you see any themes? Patterns? Choose something to elaborate on in your Instagram Feed, blog post, or any place that challenges you to write at least 3 paragraphs. You can choose something randomly, or, you can pick what stands out to you the most.

IDEA #3
For the one who has video/audio already recorded AND/OR would rather talk things out:

Use an app like www.Otter.Ai to transcribe your thoughts. Challenge yourself to talk for 5-10 minutes. Identify the keywords. Choose something to elaborate on in your Instagram Feed, blog post, or any place that challenges you to write at least 3 paragraphs. You can choose something randomly, or, you can pick what stands out to you the most.

MHN

I have also posted all of this along with more tips on my blog, morganharpernichols.com

node.title: 3 ways to go deeper with your writing

node.text:
"You never know exactly how things are going to play out in life, but this is true in both directions: You can be surprised by grief, but you can also be surprised by joy. 

And sometimes, grief and joy will overlap. You’re allowed to feel many things at once.

There are places in your life where you might feel overwhelmed with fear. And there also places where you can be overwhelmed with love.

You might be surprised by the one who broke your heart, but you can also be surprised when someone else says, “I love you for who you are.”

You might be surprised by the one who left when you needed them the most, and you might also be surprised by the support of a new friend or the kindness of a stranger.

And through every loss and every gain, you will look back and see: you experienced this life wholeheartedly and fully. Not easily, but fully.

You might remember some things you wish you could forget, and you might also forget some of the good things only to someday remember them again.

There were nights you never thought you’d make it through and there was also track number 7 on the album you couldn't stop listening to. There were months where you couldn’t catch a break, and there were also forgotten, ordinary days where you were okay. Not perfect, but okay.

There are a lot of unknowns before you and this is also true: you might end up being surprised by the courage that rises up within you, the love that continues to find you, and the grace that continues to guide you."

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on July 22, 2021. May be an image of text.

node.text:
I think one of the heaviest burdens
of human imagination
might be the ability
to have hindsight...

After it's all over,
past events start to seem
a lot more predictable
than they actually were.

In full color,
we start to see
what life would've looked like if only we had known
what was going to happen.

When we look back,
we can pinpoint
the conversations
that should've shown
us the clues.

We can feel the weight 
of the actions
that should've been
a big hint.

We tell ourselves,
"if only I had known...
if only I had known..."

II

I do not know
where in your life
regret seems
to scream the loudest,

but I do hope,
that whenever
you find yourself
looking back
into the tunnel
that echoes
the dissonance
of the past,

decisions
hastily made
and good things
that didn't last,

I hope
you are able to hear
the music
in your other ear.

Even if it plays softly
and you can barely hear it
through the noise,
I hope you remember,
even here,
there is room
for other tunes.

The past will not change,
but at the same time,
the present moment
is calling you
to be gentle with yourself
as you learn
to allow your imagination
to play the notes
of an all-new song.

MHN

node.text:
Back in February, someone asked me this question via an Instagram story: “How do you handle failures?”

Here was my response:

What I have learned about failure is that while it is inevitable, grace is inevitable too. Sometimes, I learn from my failures, and sometimes I don't. Sometimes, I see how it's made me stronger, and other times, I feel neutral about it. Perhaps what matters is that even when I can't see the silver lining, I do see the horizon that fills the morning sky with sunlight. I hear the chance to start again in the sound of neighbors leaving their homes to start the day.

Perhaps, what matters is that even when fear lingers, we notice how grace lingers, too. Filling up the room with music that reminds us, "even here, there is more to you."

When it comes to failure, two things can be true:

One: you are free to feel whatever you need to feel. Whether it's grief, embarrassment, disappointment, or a mixture of feelings, there is no shame if the feeling does not go away.

Two: at the same time, there is grace: unmerited favor that reminds you are loved and seen even when you're not succeeding or winning.

Continue to do your best while also knowing you are not defined by what you accomplished. You are also not defined by the times you've failed.

Even when you're worried that others might stigmatize your failure, and cause you to feel fear or shame for not winning like you're supposed to, this remains true: you matter, just by being here. And if no one has ever said those words to you, it's still true. If the people you look up to make you feel like you need to succeed more and fail less, it's still true: there is so much more to you than who you are when you are at your best and most accomplished. Of course, this is a part of your story, and it's beautiful and I hope you celebrate every mountain top moment. You are worthy of love and support when you arrive at those peaks. And you are also worthy of love and support when you are in the valley, or somewhere in between.

Failure will come.
Success will come, too. 
But it is never just the mountain or the valley that will define you.
May you learn to embrace
the entire landscape of who you are.

MHN

node.text:
One day you will look back and be so glad you chose to not give up on love. You will look back and see that even amidst the brokenness, the openness led to healing and hope that even though you had lost so much, there was still more life to go. You will find that even though love looks different than what you expected, you were still being directed, and love was still abundant. Grace was still abundant, and you were free to fall into the rhythms of trusting...trusting that no matter what was missing, there was still room in this world for your tired soul to see: you had not yet seen everything you were meant to see. You had not met yet everyone you were meant to meet...including your future self. And all along, you were worthy of love, belonging, and joy just as much as anyone else.

Having hope for the future does not mean you think everything will go perfectly and according to plan. It means you are choosing to believe you can keep an open hand. To hold the flower. The paintbrush. The camera. The fruit. Any little thing that reminds you: after everything, you are free to keep going. Even in the waiting, you are free to keep creating.

This year is already shaping up to be a little different than what you expected it to be, but you are not worth any less because plans have changed. You are changing in beautiful ways, beyond what you can see today.

Hold on. Keep trusting.
You do not have to be invincible before you can be strong. You are still moving right along. You might have to carry on without the one you thought was going to be there or without the places or the rooms you thought were going hold you, but you are still free to have the audacity to believe: there is more ahead of you. You have not missed out on what was meant for you.

I hope you look back and are so proud of who you were this January. I hope you see someone who was learning to be strong, even after so much went wrong. I hope you see someone anchored in hope, trusting, in the grace: there was still more life to go.

MHN

node.text:
Whenever you start to feel overwhelmed by the reality of an unknown future, I hope you can remember that today used to be one of those days that you worried so tirelessly about. Now, here you are, on the other side of that unknown, successfully making it through every moment, one breath at a time. 

Even if making it through feels like a struggle at times, this remains true: you don't have to navigate through this space perfectly to know that you are whole. You don't have to get it all right to know in the well of your soul that even here, there is room for growth, no matter what remains unknown. You may be overwhelmed by an unknown future. But I hope today, you can breathe deep and remember that these unknowns have yet to be the end of you. Look at all the changing leaves and changing seasons you have already known in this lifetime, and how even though you've known sorrow and heartbreak, you've also known joy and beauty. 

Somehow, even in the chaos of it all, it was the Light-woven things that made life worth living. In grace, you kept on seeking the good, even when life turned out differently than you thought it would. So many heavyweighted plotlines have unfolded in the unknown, but joy, love, and peace have unfolded here too. These unknowns are heavy, but they have not taken everything out of you. The fact that you're still breathing and finding Light along the path is proof: your unknowns have not defined you. Even here, there is more to you.

MHN

node.text:
You are still worthy of love. You are still worthy of knowing what it means to know to love and to be loved. I am sorry for the one who broke your trust. I am sorry for the one who took you for granted. You should have never known what it meant for a heart to be broken in that way.

But you are worthy of love, anyway.

You are worthy of being able to move forward in beautiful, healing ways. You may feel the burden of the brokenness right now, but there is still much more to your story. Your life is not a checklist.

Just because the things you hoped for have fallen out of place does not mean you cannot keep living a meaningful, purposeful life. As long as you are breathing, you are not out of time. No matter what is not checked off on the “list,” you are still being called to go on the journey. Even amidst the brokenness. Even amidst the sadness. These feelings are real, but this is not all there is to you.

And you are going to move on.
My friend, you are going to move on.
You are going to wake up one day and realize:
certain things no longer bother you.
They may cross your mind from time to time,
but it will not feel the same,
and it is then you will realize:
you have grown
in beautiful, healing ways.

You have spent so many nights trying to communicate what you feel. You have spent so many years trying to get to the core of it all. You have wondered what you missed or what you could have done differently. And you have also been invited to step into Light and believe that even amidst the brokenness, you still have the capacity for love. The one that hurt you could not take that from you.

And love will look different here and in the seasons to come, but that will be a beautiful thing. You will find this was what you were needing: a new beginning. A new way of living. A new way of trusting that despite the one who broke your trust, you were still free to hope, to believe, to love.

MHN

node.text:
When you don’t feel as confident in the present because of an unknown future:

Finding joy
in the waiting
does not mean
you are giving up.
It is saying,
this right here
is enough
as I wait
for what’s to come.

May today be the day
you find joy
while you wait

And breathe.
Just breathe.
This small act of release
is still a way of finding peace.

You do not have to have the answers for everything
to live a wholehearted life right here in the present moment.
When you are faced with in decision,
you are free to take deep breaths
knowing that there will always be mountains and valleys
and you will inevitably learn something with every step.
And you will find that confidence grows not when things are perfect
but when you learn to fully embrace who you are, where you are.

So come out from behind the worry
that you are not good enough, smart enough, ready enough.
Come out into the wide open landscape of gloriously abundant peace
that goes beyond your understanding,
where there is room to breathe and simply breathe,
no matter your uncertainty.

MHN

node.text:
I am letting go. I am finally free to outgrow the spaces that tried to restrain me. 

I will leave the lies behind and I will grow boldly under the sun. I will trust that my fears will not hinder who I become.

I am not who I used to be and that is a beautiful thing.

MHN

node.text:
The uncertainty is overwhelming,
and it leaves you with more questions than answers.
It makes you wonder if you are headed in the right direction.
It makes you wonder if you should be trying
to push forward a little more,
or if you should learn to be a little more still.
There’s all this back and forth,
to and fro, like waves tossing over one another
in a tireless sea.

But for all that has changed,
and all that has stayed the same,
for every mixed feeling,
and all the words that went unsaid,
you are still being led into the arms of boundless peace..
allowing you to rest, breathe deep, take heart, and keep going.

For in all that is missing, 
you do not have to miss out
on the opportunity to have hope..
to have hope that:

You have not seen everything you were meant to see.
You have not met everyone you were meant to meet.
You have not done all the things you were meant to do.
You have not traveled to all of the landscapes
you were meant to travel to.
You have seen a lot of the ocean,
but there are still further depths. 
Take heart, breathe deep.
You are far from finished yet.

mhn

node.text:
You’ve had to work so hard to get to this point
and there’s a lot of pressure on you,
but perhaps the best way forward
is learning to trust:
you can only do what you can do.
And even in moments of rest,
strength is still rising up within you. 

What new beginnings are longing to come alive from within you?
Allow yourself to sit with this question.
And perhaps, you will discover the answer with time,
right here in the waiting.

Maybe in the silence,
you will work your way inward,
and find a different kind of listening.

Perhaps, in this place, you will remember:
you came to this earth as a baby
ready to receive and learn so many things.
You did not know what was ahead of you.
And yet, you were fully present.

You have come such a long way from those days,
but you are worthy of coming alive where you are,
all the same. Even while you wait.

For even here, there is grace.

Yes, there is wildness.
Yes, there are questions.
Yes, there are difficult changes
you are trying to live with.
And there are also
these small moments
to let joy in
again and again and again.

So for whatever you are creating in this season,
and for whatever you are going deeper into,
I hope you can begin to see this moment as a gift.

I hope you can remember the greater landscape,
for you are a part of something so much greater than you.
Dare to be present to this very moment.
Let grace lead you through.

Trust: in these wild unknowns,
there is room to be okay.
Trust: in these wild unknowns,
your story is still taking shape.

MHN

node.text: One day you will look back in awe of the things you made it through. You will look back with gratitude for the grace that continued to find you ♥️
